titles: King William and Queen Mary, conquerors, or, A discourse endeavouring to prove that Their Majesties have on their side, against the late king, the principal reasons that make conquest a good title shewing also how this is consistent with that declaration of Parliament, King James abdicated the government, &c. : written with an especial regard to such as have hitherto refused the oath, and yet incline to allow of the title of conquest, when consequent to a just war.
author: Blount, Charles, 1654-1693.
notes: Attributed to Charles Blount. Cf. BM.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  William and Mary, 1689-1702.
